Sentencas: In the present work, an ethanol fed Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine ( SOFC-GT) system has been parametrically analyzed in terms of exergy and compared with a single SOFC system.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol

Sentencas: The solid oxide fuel cell was fed with hydrogen produced from ethanol steam reforming.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol

Sentencas: The hydrogen utilization factor values were kept between 0.7 and 1.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol

Sentencas: The SOFC's Current-Volt performance was considered in the range of 0.1-3 A/cm(2) at 0.9-0.3 V, respectively, and at the intermediate operating temperatures of 550 and 600 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol

Sentencas: The curves used represent experimental results obtained from the available bibliography.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol

Sentencas: Results indicated that for low current density values the single SOFC system prevails over the SOFC-GT hybrid system in terms of exergy efficiency, while at higher current density values the latter is more efficient.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol

Sentencas: It was found that as the value of the utilization factor increases the SOFC system becomes more efficient than the SOFC-GT system over a wider range of current density values.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol

Sentencas: It was also revealed that at high current density values the increase of SOFC operation temperature leads in both cases to higher system efficiency values.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of an Intermediate Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid System Fed with Ethanol
